concept.title: Manual Inspection of Drawband and Mainspring
concept.shortdesc: Visual and manual inspection of the drawband and mainspring helps identify loosened connections and reduced tension that affect carriage performance.

conbody.p: Inspection begins by moving the carriage to the right side of the machine. A visual check of the drawband helps determine whether it has loosened or disconnected from the spring barrel. Manually rotating the spring barrel reveals whether it maintains tension or moves freely. Lack of resistance indicates loss of spring tension and potential need for repair.
